SourcedStatement: “Georgia law does not permit a private company to take land through eminent domain unless the land will be put to a public use,” said Bill Maurer, senior attorney for Institute for Justice who represents the landowners. “Building a rail spur that will only be used by a few private companies, and not the public at large, is not a public use. We look forward to making it clear to the court that the [Public Service Commission] made an error in considering Sandersville’s land grab as a public use.”
